intro: Galatella songorica var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved galatella, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
